results.title: The Jungle Book
results.creator_credit: Disney Studio Artist, Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.credit_line:
Disney Studio Artist

Story Sketch

Conte crayon, marker, and ink on paper
results.material_description: Conte crayon, marker, and ink on paper
results.brief_description: Another animated classic from the Disney studios. Mowgli, the man-cub raised by wolves, must leave the jungle to take his place in the man-village. The journey is a dangerous one as Shere-Khan, the mighty tiger has sworn to kill the man-cub. Mowgli, accompanied by his loyal friends, Bagheera the panther, and Baloo, the irresponsible bear, meet an array of friends who help Mowgli escape Shere-Khan. A delightful score and voices by stars such as Phil Harris, George Sanders and Sebastion Cabot, make this a “song-filled celebration you’ll never forget.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.description:
When the jungle comes alive with rumours of the man-hating tiger Shere Khan’s return, the wise panther Bagheera knows he’ll have to get the man-cub Mowgli to safety. After being raised by wolves in the Indian jungle, Mowgli is reluctant to leave his home – despite the impending danger. Under the guidance of Bagheera and the laid-back bear Baloo, Mowgli adventures through the jungle to discover friendship, loyalty and his place in the world, while meeting a fabulous cast of friends and foes.

The Jungle Book (1967), Walt Disney Animation Studio’s classic musical adaptation of Rudyard Kipling’s beloved book, has been an animated favourite for over 50 years and features the voice talents of some of the biggest stars of the day, as well as gorgeous animation, classic characters and iconic music and songs from the Sherman Brothers and Terry Gilkyson.

Frank Thomas and Ollie Johnston supervised the animation for Mowgli and Baloo, who feature in the above sketch. The contrasting size and movements of the young boy and easy-going bear balance one another throughout the film. In the lively musical sequence the “Bare Necessities”, Mowgli appears clumsy and a little unsure while the wise Baloo dances gracefully to the rhythm of the accompanying jazz music, all the while showing Mowgli the ways of the jungle.
description_for_label:

results.title: Moana
results.creator_credit: Lisa Keane, Ron Clements, Walt Disney Animation Studios and John Musker
results.brief_description: In Ancient Polynesia, when a terrible curse incurred by Maui reaches an impetuous Chieftain’s daughter’s island, she answers the Ocean’s call to seek out the demigod to set things right.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

constellations_other.name: Go Bang
constellations_other.description: Australian dance act PNAU are renowned for groundbreaking visuals in their music videos, including for their 2017 single 'Go Bang' which featured Kira Divine.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lisa Keane, Ron Clements, Walt Disney Animation Studios and John Musker
results.description:
In ancient Polynesia, the young, soon-to-be-chieftain Moana must enlist the help of the shape-shifting demi-god Maui to find the heart of the goddess Te Fiti, and save her home from encroaching darkness by defying her father and venturing across the sea to confront Te Kā, the volcanic demon who defeated Maui a millennia ago.

Directed by animation legends Ron Clements and John Musker (The Little Mermaid (1989), Aladdin (1992), and featuring the voice talents of Auli’i Cravalho, Dwayne ‘The Rock’ Johnson, Temuera Morrison, Jemaine Clement and Rachel House, as well as songs penned by Hamilton’s Lin-Manuel Miranda, Moana is a breathtaking instant classic from Walt Disney Animation Studios.

This stunning concept art by Lisa Keane explores the budding relationship between baby Moana and the ocean, who becomes an important guide on her adventure.
description_for_label:
In ancient Polynesia, the young, soon-to-be-chieftain Moana must enlist the help of the shape-shifting demi-god Maui to find the heart of the goddess Te Fiti, and save her home from encroaching darkness by defying her father and venturing across the sea to confront Te Kā, the volcanic demon who defeated Maui a millennia ago.

Directed by animation legends Ron Clements and John Musker (The Little Mermaid (1989), Aladdin (1992), and featuring the voice talents of Auli’i Cravalho, Dwayne ‘The Rock’ Johnson, Temuera Morrison, Jemaine Clement and Rachel House, as well as songs penned by Hamilton’s Lin-Manuel Miranda, Moana is a breathtaking instant classic from Walt Disney Animation Studios.

This stunning concept art by Lisa Keane explores the budding relationship between baby Moana and the ocean, who becomes an important guide on her adventure.

images.alt_text: A vibrant digital picture of a small Polynesian toddler in a nappy, standing in the middle of the ocean with a turtle swimming by and coral, the water not touching her but creating a wall around her

results.title: Space Invaders
results.brief_description: Space Invaders is an arcade video game developed by Tomohiro Nishikado and released in 1978. It is one of the earliest shooting games and the aim is to defeat waves of aliens with a laser cannon to earn as many points as possible.

constellations_other.name: Colour and illusion
constellations_other.description: Exploring the science of colour, light, reflection and movement.

results.description: Space Invaders is a 1978 shoot ‘em up arcade game developed by Tomohiro Nishikado. It was manufactured and sold by Taito in Japan, and licensed by the Midway division of Bally for overseas distribution.
description_for_label: Space Invaders is a 1978 shoot ‘em up arcade game developed by Tomohiro Nishikado. It was manufactured and sold by Taito in Japan, and licensed by the Midway division of Bally for overseas distribution.

results.title: Spellbound Concerto record
results.brief_description: Though the theremin is most commonly associated with science fiction, it was first used in Alfred Hitchcock’s Spellbound (1945). For a dream sequence designed by Surrealist artist Salvador Dali, composer Miklós Rózsa used the theremin’s strange reverberations to produce unease and psychological tension.

results.title: Theremin
results.brief_description: The theremin was invented in 1920 and is played by harnessing electricity. Though it’s most commonly associated with sci-fi, it’s first use was in Alfred Hitchcock’s Spellbound (1945).

constellations_primary.name: Good vibrations
constellations_primary.description: Since its invention, the humble theremin has been used in a number of different ways to evoke all sorts of strange sounds and moods.

results.description: The eerie sound accompanying the alien invasion in The Day the Earth Stood Still (1951) is almost more iconic than the flying saucers themselves. Composer Bernard Herrmann created those other-worldly vibrations with duelling theremins, an instrument invented by Léon Theremin in 1920 that is played by harnessing electricity. Though the theremin is most commonly associated with science fiction, it was first used in Alfred Hitchcock’s Spellbound (1945). For a dream sequence designed by Surrealist artist Salvador Dali, composer Miklós Rózsa used the theremin’s strange reverberations to produce unease and psychological tension. The instrument has also been used in films like Ghostbusters (1984), Ed Wood (1994) and First Man (2018), along with TV shows and videogames.
description_for_label: The eerie sound accompanying the alien invasion in The Day the Earth Stood Still (1951) is almost more iconic than the flying saucers themselves. Composer Bernard Herrmann created those other-worldly vibrations with duelling theremins, an instrument invented by Léon Theremin in 1920 that is played by harnessing electricity. Though the theremin is most commonly associated with science fiction, it was first used in Alfred Hitchcock’s Spellbound (1945). For a dream sequence designed by Surrealist artist Salvador Dali, composer Miklós Rózsa used the theremin’s strange reverberations to produce unease and psychological tension. The instrument has also been used in films like Ghostbusters (1984), Ed Wood (1994) and First Man (2018), along with TV shows and videogames.

results.title: Pocket Cinema Camera 6K
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: What do the Avengers, Jason Bourne and the Expendables have in common? Aside from heroes saving the day, these film franchises all feature frenetic action sequences filmed on the BlackMagic Pocket Cinema Camera. The key isn’t just the Hollywood-quality 6K resolution (it helps though), but the size of the camera. Filmmakers have strapped them to motorbikes, cars, trucks, boats and even tanks, with their size allowing minimal rigging and creative approaches to capturing breathtaking action. What also helps is that they’re made from carbon fibre/polycarbonate composite material so they’re super strong but also lightweight. First sketched out and designed on 3D CAD (Computer Assisted Design) software, prototypes are then made from 3D prints while the internal components are miniaturised to ensure hand-held use without losing their cinematic quality.
